thread.title: North Texas runners perform strong at national events, weekend race results
thread.title_full: North Texas runners perform strong at national events, weekend race results | Dallas Morning News

author: Debbie Fetterman
title: North Texas runners perform strong at national events, weekend race results
text:
Aledo 's Megan Flowers Skeels won Sunday's Mohawk Hudson Marathon in New York in 2:46:39. Skeels, 41, won $1,500 and secured an automatic entry in the Boston Marathon with her sub 2:48 finish. She missed out on securing a 2016 Olympic Trials marathon slot. She needed to run 2:43:00 or faster.
Numerous North Texas runners were among the 40,000 racing Sunday's Chicago Marathon. Many set personal bests including Dallas' Dawn Grunnagle. She finished in 2 hours, 49 minutes, 43 seconds. Grunnagle improved upon her first marathon finish by nearly six minutes.
Other North Texans who ran personal bests at Chicago include: Keller's Randy Bobe (2:47:48), Dallas' Jennifer Piazza (3:49:08), Dallas' Nina Chow (3:53:57) and Plano's Stacey Rotunno (3:59:17).
Dallas' Shaheen Sattar, 31, won the overall woman's title at Sunday's Tyler Rose Marathon. She finished 10th overall in 3:20:19. Dallas' Isaac Escamilla, 22, won his age group and placed eighth overall at Sunday's Tyler Rose Marathon in 3:12:24.
If you or someone you know ran a personal best at Sunday's Chicago Marathon or elsewhere, drop me an e-mail at dfetterman@dfwrunning.com, and I'll try to give you/them a shout out!
